is a small city (about 40,000 people, not including suburbs) in south central
. It is the seat and largest city in
, and the center of the Houma-Bayou Cane-Thibodaux Metropolitan Statistical Area. The region in total is home to a little over 200,000.

value: Houma: Terrebonne Parish Court House, Main Street

Bayou Terrebonne runs through the town roughly east to west between Main Street and Park Avenue, with the Intracostal Waterway running north to south.

Houma, Louisiana is just off Highway 90 south New Orleans Louisiana.

Directions from New Orleans (approx. 59 miles or 1 hour, 15 minutes):
#Merge onto I-10 W (9.7 miles)
#Merge onto I-310 S via exit 220 to Boutte/Houma (12.0 miles)
#Exit at US-90 W toward Houma (30.07 miles)
#Turn left at LA-24 E toward Houma (7.3 miles)

Directions from Lafayette, LA (approx. 104 miles or 2 hours, 10 minutes):
#From I-10, merge onto US-167 S via the US-90/US-167 S exit 103A to Lafayette (2.6 miles)
#Continue on US-90 E (93.8 miles)
#Turn right at LA-24 E (7.3 miles)

value: content=Small museum focuses on local relationship to the wetlands habitat.
name=Chauvin Sculpture Garden & NSU Folk Art Studio
hours=Sculpture garden 8AM-5PM daily; art studio Sa-Su 11AM-4PM or by appointment
content=The garden has more than 100 concrete sculptures.
price=Adults $3, seniors 55+ $2, students $1, children under 6 and active military free

content=Focuses on the military history and contributions of Houma and the surrounding area, with special focus on World War II. Veterans give tours of the exhibits. When they're not too busy, they'll let you try some "hands on" with some of the artifacts.
directions=just off Little Bayou Black Dr in the South west part of town
price=Adults $10, seniors 65+ and college students $8, children 6-18 $5, children under 6 free
content=Historic plantation house is now home to the Terrebonne Museum of History and Culture.
content=Enter another world, as you venture into the interior of the swamps only accessible by airboat. See alligators, birds and other wildlife.
content=Southland Mall offers Dillards, JCPenney, Sears and a hundred shops. MC, V, Discover and travelers checks accepted.
address=5602 West Main Street, Houma, LA, 70364
content=Shrimp, crabs, crawfish, oysters, turtle, alligator, gumbo, etoufee, po-boys, salads, plate lunches and more. Credit cards accepted: A/E/, D, M/C, V.

content=Catering to the indulgent diner, as well as the health conscious foodie, our goal is to bring a new kind of dinning experience to the bayou by using organic produce, all natural and free range meats, along side the wonderful seafood from our local waters.
, two locations: 7881 Main Street, tel 853-1090, lunch Mon-Fri; 6897 West Park Ave, tel 853-2090 Mon-Sat  11 a - 9 p, also offering drive through food pickup.
directions=half a block off Main Street
content=Tel 897-2426. Medium priced Italian lunch and dinner. Lunch Mon-Fri; Dinner Mon-Sat; Jazz Brunch Sunday. Sometimes has live jazz other times as well.
content=Tel 223-2442. Breakfast, lunch, coffee, or snacks. Mon-Fri 7a - 4p, Sat 8a-3p. Free wi-fi computer access for customers; pay access for non-customers.
content=Tel 872-1507. Local favorite for simple but tasty breakfast and lunch; reasonably priced.

content=Family run B&B on northeast side of town. Ten miles to Chabert Medical Center and five minutes to route 90. Three bedrooms are for rent. One bedroom has a private bath. Two bedrooms share a bath. Rentals are available daily, weekly, or long term.
